text:
Joined @GiffordsCourage, @RepJahanaHayes, @RepJasonCrow, & @ryandbusse as a responsible gun owner, hunter, & veteran to call for gun violence prevention action.

We have a responsibility to stand up against the unhinged gun lobby in DC to save lives & protect our communities. https://t.co/Pq2BOIYzWT

Congratulations to all of this year’s US Service Academy candidates from California’s Fifth District.

It was great to spend time with them and their families last night and to celebrate their admittance to the Air Force Academy, Naval Academy, NAPS and West Point. https://t.co/dxoVNFO9s5

Congratulations to Rohnert Park on the groundbreaking of the Homekey project!

This project will create 60 units of interim housing for individuals experiencing homelessness in our community. I look forward to seeing the impact of this project https://t.co/FNaWwcxxoZ

REMINDER: Make sure your ballot has all of the required information completed and is postmarked by today, June 7 and delivered by June 14 for your ballot to count.

You can find ballot drop off locations by visiting @CASOSVote here: https://t.co/b9ha7mnzIn
I look forward to seeing President Joe Biden sign this bill into law and honor Art’s incredible life and legacy.

Great news! The Senate passed my bill to rename the Cotati Post Office in honor of the Pasta King, Art Ibleto. Art created a successful restaurant & catering business, raised hundreds of thousands of dollars for charitable causes, and uplifted our community at every opportunity.

Two weeks ago, 21 lives were taken at Robb Elementary School, including 19 children.

We cannot allow their memories to be forgotten. We must pass my bill with @RepJerryNadler and @JacksonLeeTX18, the Protecting Our Kids Act — delays are not an option.

Today is the primary election in California! Voting is the most vital tool in our democracy, and I encourage every Californian to get out and exercise their right to vote.

Visit @CASOSVote website for info on how to vote: https://t.co/yOLF0V16I8

This past weekend, 15 people were killed in mass shootings.
 
Every day, 30 people are killed by someone using a gun.
 
This can't be allowed to be the new normal. Gun violence has no place in our communities & the House is ready to take action on bills that will help save lives.

Wearing orange started when Hadiya Pendleton’s friends commemorated her life by wearing orange after she was shot and killed.

For #WearOrange Day, I challenged our constituents to raise awareness about gun violence by sending in photos wearing orange. Thanks for participating! https://t.co/dVH5yXyJFc

Great to kick-off the Napa Climate NOW Road to a Livable Climate Ride & Walk in Napa yesterday.

Climate change is one of the most pressing issues we face, and by using our collective voices, we can call for the change that we need to protect our planet for generations to come. https://t.co/EZupDT0YC4

This is a strong move by @POTUS to boost US renewable energy production.
 
To combat the climate crisis, the US needs to transition to sustainable energy. It’s time to deal with the climate crisis head on, and that includes making my GREEN Act law. 
 
https://t.co/7GpwhdDLwJ

This week, the House is taking strong action to combat gun violence, including passing red flag legislation and my bill, the Protecting Our Kids Act, to help keep our communities safe and save lives. 2/2

https://t.co/HwE1YToMeO
Another weekend of mass shootings in the only country where this is a regular occurrence.  This is in addition to everyday gun violence the media often does not cover. 1/2

On this day in 1944, Allied Forces stormed the beaches of Normandy to liberate Europe from the grasp of tyranny, authoritarianism, and ruthless genocide.

Today, we remember and express our gratitude to those who fought on D-Day and throughout the war to eradicate this evil.

HAPPENING NOW: I am going live with @ChrisMurphyCT to discuss what Congress is doing to help save lives and protect our communities from gun violence.
 
Join us:

https://t.co/UIiCfNHm7B

We want to protect people.

This week, the House will vote to pass bills to #EndGunViolence and help protect schools, places of worship, grocery stores, concerts, theaters, and everywhere else mass shootings occur in our communities.

I encourage all of my colleagues to vote yes. https://t.co/dcrHwZonks

Reminder that the CDC has recommended a third dose of the Pfizer COVID vaccine for children ages 5 to 11. 

If eligible, please make sure your children are vaccinated to help protect them and our communities.

ICYM: I joined women leaders in Sonoma County to discuss the importance of protecting a woman’s ability to make decisions that affect her health and economic security. 

Learn more about our press conference below.  

https://t.co/aF8R06fM8M

TOMORROW at 10 am PT, join me and Senator Chris Murphy for a town hall on gun violence prevention.  

You can watch this important discussion on my Facebook page. https://t.co/zxWl667tip

On Monday, June 6 at 10 am PT, I will be hosting a virtual town hall with Senator Chris Murphy to discuss what Congress is doing to prevent gun violence and protect our communities.  
You can watch our discussion live on my Facebook page. We hope to see you there! https://t.co/cYsLPJHvHU
Great to join our community in the Sonoma County Pride Parade! It’s wonderful to see such a great turnout to celebrate our LGBTQ+ community! https://t.co/2JuSfrBPps

Congratulations to the Napa Valley Register for winning nine certificates and earning first place for best feature photo in the 2021 California Journalism Awards! Thank you for your hard work to bring quality journalism to our community. 
 
https://t.co/AIRtBxQrl6

ICYM: I held a press conference with Napa County Women leaders to discuss the need to protect a woman’s ability to make decisions about her health. I am committed to ensuring women have access to reproductive care.   
 
https://t.co/IdYZqiWUqR

Thank you to The Manzanita Elementary Parent Teacher Association for supporting the Robb Elementary School Parent Teacher Organization in Uvalde. Our community is proud of your kindness and generosity. https://t.co/2lq1ejmUMa

Instead of being commended, he saw his path to re-election in his Republican primary dry up, and he announced that he would no longer run for reelection. How many kids need to die before this isn’t the political reality?

https://t.co/s6FYEygXhJ

What is happening to the Republican party isn’t just a Republican problem, it is problem for all Americans. Rep. Chris Jacobs (R-NY) responded to the devastating gun violence in Buffalo, NY with public support for gun violence prevention policies that would keep communities safe.
Don’t forget to send your #WearOrange challenge photos to wearorange@mail.house.gov. I look forward to sharing them! https://t.co/pUhSpm0rRh

Senator Chris Murphy and I will be hosting a virtual town hall on gun violence prevention to discuss what Congress is doing to help save lives and protect our communities. Join us live on Monday, June 6 at 10 am PT. https://t.co/K1ply8mxKO

I will continue to fight to enact commonsense gun legislation that will save lives and protect our communities. 2/2 

https://t.co/xRX3qSiJsO

Proud to announce that the Judiciary Committee has passed H.R. 7910, Protecting Our Kids Act. I am a coauthor of this legislation that will crack down on gun trafficking, raise the age to purchase certain firearms, & strengthen safe gun storage rules to help end gun violence. 1/2

On National Gun Violence Awareness Day, I wear orange to remember and fight for the lives lost to senseless acts of gun violence. The time is NOW to pass commonsense legislation that will save lives. Please join me and #WearOrange today to #EndGunViolence. https://t.co/sEWoF8Qrvo

TODAY at 10 am PT, join me and @RepAnnaEshoo for a virtual town hall to discuss gun violence prevention and answer your questions.  
 
Make sure to sign up using the link below. We look forward to seeing you there. 

https://t.co/6GFGdO3HlP https://t.co/di86NVeX0R

The gun violence epidemic is only getting worse, especially for our children. Gun violence is a public safety emergency, and the time is now for Congress to pass sensible legislation to protect our communities.

https://t.co/X6ntanAjHk

Congratulations to @NorthBayNews on winning 52 awards for public service and investigative reporting from the California Newspaper Publishers Association!

Thank you for uplifting important stories in our community. We are proud of your hard work. 
 
https://t.co/40Jbn5MAoa

This legislation includes commonsense measures that will help end gun violence and save lives, and I am excited that the Judiciary Committee is marking up this important legislation today.  
 
Learn more about this important bill below. 2/2

https://t.co/rdORouOKr6
This week, I introduced H.R. 7910, Protecting Our Kids Act, with my colleagues Congressman Jerry Nadler and Congresswoman Sheila Jackson Lee to combat gun violence and protect our communities. 1/2
If you haven’t already, make sure to send your #WearOrange challenge photos to wearorange@mail.house.gov. We will share them tomorrow, on Wear Orange Day. https://t.co/XILEMHoL59
PER NAPA COUNTY OES: Old Fire Update: Road closures and evacuation orders lifted. Please use caution while traveling in the area. https://t.co/PWlSqgP29Q

This Friday, June 3rd at 10 am PT, I will join my colleague Congresswoman Anna Eshoo for a virtual town hall to discuss what Congress is doing to reduce gun violence and save lives. 
 
Please use the link below to register. We hope to see you there. 
 
https://t.co/6GFGdO3HlP https://t.co/vBG0KwfEab

As we mark the start of Pride Month, we celebrate the members of the LGBTQ+ community and recognize their contributions to our community and recommit ourselves to ensuring a future free from discrimination and inequality. https://t.co/rxMHJJZbUJ

As a gun owner, I believe that the Second Amendment is strengthened when responsible gun owners stand up for pragmatic and reasonable measures, like background checks, that help keep guns out of the hands of  criminals and the dangerously mentally ill. 2/2
When guns fall into the wrong hands, it puts people at risk and threatens our Second Amendment rights. 1/2

Stood shoulder to shoulder with women leaders across Napa County in support of access to reproductive care.  Everyone should have the freedom to make personal health care decisions that impact their lives, health, and futures. https://t.co/X0DOsF8m9a

Join my #WearOrange challenge to end gun violence and protect our communities! Please send your photos to wearorange@mail.house.gov and we will share them on Friday, Wear Orange Day. https://t.co/XFB3ah6gPN

Congratulations to the Wine Business Institute on its 25th anniversary!  You've been a vital center for our wine community.  Your work will help ensure the continued success of CA winemaking and I was honored to present a Congressional Record Statement to mark this milestone. https://t.co/taTkJOK4qf

On the one-week anniversary of tragic shooting in Uvalde, Texas where 19 children and two adults were killed, I led our community in a candlelight vigil to honor the lives lost on that devastating day as well as the 30 lives lost to gun violence every day. https://t.co/5xkkJvdxRc
